newsitem.title: CANADA: Volvo unit suspends production in Quebec.
newsitem.headline: Volvo unit suspends production in Quebec.

text.p: Prevost Car Inc., a subsidiary of AB Volvo and Henlys Group Plc, said on Monday it has temporarily suspended all production at its three Quebec plants because of problems with its unions.

"Given the situation that has prevailed for the past four weeks, during which pressure tactics have steadily increased to the point of disrupting every aspect of the company's operations, the company feels compelled to act in order to avoid future deterioration of the situation," Prevost Car president and CEO Georges Bourelle said in a statement.
Bourelle said the company will make an offer to all of its 1,200 workers on July 13 and is convinced the management's proposal will be accepted.
The union is pressing for a wage increase and improvement in the management of the employee pension fund.
Prevost Car, which produces autocars and buses, is based in Ste. Claire near Quebec City.
It is 51 per cent-owned by AB Volvo and 49 per cent by Henlys Group Plc.
